de.ovgu.featureide.fm.core.constraint.analysis

Interface PBSolver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SAT4JPBSolver

    public interface PBSolver
    The PBSolver interface encapsulates the functionality of a pseudo boolean satisfiability solver. Each class that implements this interface can be plugged in to reason on extended feature models.
    Author:
    Sebastian Henneberg

        <T extends Restriction> void addRestriction(T restriction)
        Adds a restriction to the pseudo boolean satisfiability solver.

        Parameters:

      • addRestrictions

        <T extends Restriction> void addRestrictions(java.util.Collection<T> restrictions)
        Adds restrictions to the pseudo boolean satisfiability solver.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The concrete type of the restrictions.
        Parameters:
        restrictions - The restrictions to add.

      • isSatisfiable

        boolean isSatisfiable()
        Is the currently submitted set of restrictions satisfiable?
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one satisfying assignments, false otherwise.

      • isSatisfiable

        boolean isSatisfiable(int[] assumptions)
        Is the currently submitted set of restrictions satisfiable with respect of the passed assumptions?
        Parameters:
        assumptions - An array of temporary assumption used for this call.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least one satisfying assignments, false otherwise.

      • backbone

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> backbone(java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> varibales)
        Verifies if the passed variables are either true or false for all satisfying assignments. Returns +id for each true assignments and -id for each false assignment in the resulting set. In general, the resulting set contains fewer elements than the input set because some variables are not yet statically assigned.
        Parameters:
        varibales - The indices of the variables to examine.
        Returns:
        Those variables that are statically assigned and their assignment.
